item.title: Chaotician add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "One should always play fairly when one has the winning cards." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Chaotician add a quote by Ronald Reagan
item.description: "I have left orders to be awakened at any time during national emergency, even if I'm in a cabinet meeting." -- Ronald Reagan

item.title: Chaotician add a quote by Napoleon Bonaparte
item.description: "Never interrupt your enemy when he is making a mistake." -- Napoleon Bonaparte

item.title: Chaotician add a quote by Ironhide
item.description: "You feelin' lucky, punk?" -- Ironhide

item.title: Chaotician add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Those are my principles, and if you don't like them...well I have others." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Chaotician add a quote by Salvador Dali
item.description: "The only difference between me and a madman is I'm not mad." -- Salvador Dali

item.title: Chaotician add a quote by Bill Cosby
item.description: "And so the dentist says 'Rinse.' So you lean over, and you're lookin' at this miniature toilet bowl." -- Bill Cosby

item.title: Chaotician add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "Cabbage: A familiar kitchen-garden vegetable about as large and wise as a man's head." -- Ambrose Bierce

item.title: Chaotician add a quote by Robert E. Lee
item.description: "It is well that war is so terrible, or we should grow too fond of it." -- Robert E. Lee

item.title: Chaotician add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "A person's a person, no matter how small." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Chaotician add a quote by Johann wolfgang von Goethe
item.description: "Divide and rule, a sound motto. Unite and lead, a better one." -- Johann wolfgang von Goethe

item.title: Chaotician add a quote by John Wayne
item.description: "Life's hard. It's even harder when you're stupid." -- John Wayne

item.title: Chaotician add a quote by Francois de La Rochefoucauld
item.description: "The height of cleverness is to be able to conceal it." -- Francois de La Rochefoucauld

item.title: Chaotician add a quote by Arthur Conan Doyle
item.description: "When you have eliminated all which is impossible, then whatever remains, however improbable, must be the truth." -- Arthur Conan Doyle

item.title: Chaotician add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Chaotician add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description:
"All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost; The old that is strong does not wither, Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
From the ashes a fire shall be woken, A light from the shadows shall spring; Renewed shall be blade that was broken, The crownless again shall be king." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Chaotician add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I was gratified to be able to answer promptly, and I did. I said I didnâ€™t know." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Chaotician add a quote by Arthur Schopenhauer
item.description: "Talent hits a target no one else can hit. Genius hits a target no one else can see." -- Arthur Schopenhauer

item.title: Chaotician add a quote by Oscar Levant
item.description: "There's a fine line between genius and insanity. I have erased this line." -- Oscar Levant

item.title: Chaotician add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "One ought never to turn one's back on a threatened danger and try to run away from it. If you do that, you will double the danger. But if you meet it promptly and without flinching, you will reduce the danger by half." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Chaotician add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Noise proves nothing. Often a hen who has laid an egg cackles as if she had laid an asteroid." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Chaotician add a quote by Theodore Roosevelt
item.description: "When they call the roll in the Senate, the Senators do not know whether to answer 'Present' or 'Not Guilty'." -- Theodore Roosevelt

item.title: Chaotician add a quote by H. H. Munro
item.description: "He is one of those people who would be enormously improved by death." -- H. H. Munro

item.title: Chaotician add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "Common sense is not so common." -- Voltaire

item.title: Chaotician add a quote by Francis Bacon
item.description: "In taking revenge, a man is but even with his enemy; but in passing it over, he is superior." -- Francis Bacon

item.title: Chaotician add a quote by Euripides
item.description: "Talk sense to a fool and he calls you foolish." -- Euripides

item.title: Chaotician add a quote by Jonathan Swift
item.description: "May you live every day of your life." -- Jonathan Swift

item.title: Chaotician add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "If you done it, it ain't bragging." -- Walt Whitman

item.title: Chaotician add a quote by George Washington
item.description: "It is better to offer no excuse than a bad one." -- George Washington

item.title: Chaotician add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "Historians are like deaf people who go on answering questions that no one has asked them." -- Leo Tolstoy
